title: 115_hr1143
content: The Act titled "Hygiene Assistance for Families of Infants and Toddlers Act of 2017" aims to improve diaper distribution through a demonstration project under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will make grants for demonstration projects to help families with eligible children address diapering needs. Funds will be used for diaper distribution projects to reduce costs for low-income families and evaluate the effects on health risks like diaper dermatitis and urinary tract infections. The grant program aims to assist families with infants and toddlers who lack an adequate supply of diapers. Eligible entities include governmental entities, Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and nonprofit organizations. Applicants must submit an application to the Secretary to demonstrate the likelihood of achieving the grant's purposes. The grant program assists families with infants and toddlers in need of diapers. Eligible entities include governmental entities, Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and nonprofit organizations. Assistance provided under the grant will not affect eligibility for other federal or state-funded needs-based programs. Recipients must submit a report to the Secretary detailing the number of children and families served. The grant program assists families with infants and toddlers in need of diapers. Eligible entities include governmental entities, Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and nonprofit organizations. Recipients must submit a report to the Secretary detailing the number of children and families served, the number and types of diapers distributed, distribution methods, and any other required information. The Secretary will evaluate the effectiveness of the diaper distribution projects by September 30, 2019. The section requires the Secretary to evaluate diaper distribution projects, report to Congress, and publish results online. Updates must be made by September 30, 2022, with subsequent reporting and website updates. In this section, definitions are provided for terms such as 'diaper', 'diapering supplies', and 'eligible child'. The term 'diaper' refers to an absorbent garment for non-toilet-trained children. 'Diapering supplies' include items like wipes and cream for diaper care. An 'eligible child' is defined as a child under 4 years old who is not toilet-trained and comes from a low-income family. The term 'toilet-trained' means able to use a toilet consistently without needing diapers. Authorization of appropriations is set at $25,000,000 for fiscal years 2018-2022.
